message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Metformin and acarbose are both antidiabetic agents but do not affect renal function. Ifosfamide is a chemotherapy drug and is not used to treat diabetes.

Ifosfamide is a chemotherapy agent and acarbose is a medication used to treat type 2 diabetes by delaying carbohydrate digestion.
